item.title: OpenAI: GPT-5 is coming, "we'll see" if it creates a shockwave
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI's next foundational and state-of-the-art model, GPT-5, is still on its way after a delay. OpenAI won't tell us the release date for now. [...]

item.title: Citrix Bleed 2 exploited weeks before PoCs as Citrix denied attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A critical Citrix NetScaler vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-5777 and dubbed "CitrixBleed 2," was actively exploited nearly two weeks before proof-of-concept (PoC) exploits were made public, despite Citrix stating that there was no evidence of attacks. [...]

item.title: VMware fixes four ESXi zero-day bugs exploited at Pwn2Own Berlin
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: VMware fixed four vulnerabilities in VMware ESXi, Workstation, Fusion, and Tools that were exploited as zero-days during the Pwn2Own Berlin 2025 hacking contest in May 2025. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Teams voice calls abused to push Matanbuchus malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Matanbuchus malware loader has been seen being distributed through social engineering over Microsoft Teams calls impersonating IT helpdesk. [...]

item.title: Google sues to disrupt BadBox 2.0 botnet infecting 10 million devices
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Google has filed a lawsuit against the anonymous operators of the Android BadBox 2.0 malware botnet, accusing them of running a global ad fraud scheme against the company's advertising platforms. [...]

item.title: LameHug malware uses AI LLM to craft Windows data-theft commands in real-time
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A novel malware family named LameHug is using a large language model (LLM) to generate commands to be executed on compromised Windows systems. [...]

item.title: Hacker steals $27 million in BigONE exchange crypto breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cryptocurrency exchange BigONE announced that it suffered a security breach, in which hackers stole various digital assets valued at $27 million. [...]

item.title: Chinese hackers breached National Guard to steal network configurations
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Chinese state-sponsored hacking group known as Salt Typhoon breached and remained undetected in a U.S. Army National Guard network for nine months in 2024, stealing network configuration files and administrator credentials that could be used to compromise other government networks. [...]

item.title: Max severity Cisco ISE bug allows pre-auth command execution, patch now
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A critical vulnerability (CVE-2025-20337) in Cisco's Identity Services Engine (ISE) could be exploited to let an unauthenticated attacker store malicious files, execute arbitrary code, or gain root privileges on vulnerable devices. [...]

item.title: Co-op confirms data of 6.5 million members stolen in cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: UK retailer Co-op has confirmed that personal data of 6.5 million members was stolen in the massive cyberattack in April that shut down systems and caused food shortages in its grocery stores. [...]

item.title: U.S. Army soldier pleads guilty to extorting 10 tech, telecom firms
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A 21-year old former U.S. Army soldier pleaded guilty to charges of hacking and extorting at least ten telecommunications and technology companies in the country. [...]

item.title: Louis Vuitton says regional data breaches tied to same cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Luxury fashion giant Louis Vuitton confirmed that breaches impacting customers in the UK, South Korea, and Turkey stem from the same security incident, which is believed to be linked to the ShinyHunters extortion group. [...]
